unnormalised: ## Yoga Practices: My Journey from Chaos to Calm
normalised: ## Yoga Practices: My Journey from Chaos to Calm

unnormalised: I never understood the hype around yoga. Growing up in Delhi, it always seemed like something my mom did at 6:00 AM while I was still struggling to wake up for school. I associated it with complicated asanas and chanting, things that seemed far removed from my stressful life as a software engineer.
normalised: I never understood the hype around yoga. Growing up in Delhi, it always seemed like something my mom did at six A M while I was still struggling to wake up for school. I associated it with complicated asanas and chanting, things that seemed far removed from my stressful life as a software engineer.

unnormalised: Everything changed in 2022. I was constantly overwhelmed, juggling deadlines at work, family commitments, and the never-ending Delhi traffic. My anxiety was through the roof. My doctor, a staunch believer in holistic wellness, suggested I try yoga. Skeptical, but desperate, I enrolled in a beginner's class at a studio near my office in Gurgaon.
normalised: Everything changed in two thousand and twenty two. I was constantly overwhelmed, juggling deadlines at work, family commitments, and the never-ending Delhi traffic. My anxiety was through the roof. My doctor, a staunch believer in holistic wellness, suggested I try yoga. Skeptical, but desperate, I enrolled in a beginner's class at a studio near my office in Gurgaon.

unnormalised: My initial attempts were clumsy and frustrating. I couldn't hold a downward-facing dog for more than 10 seconds, and my attempts at Trikonasana were laughable. But something kept me going back. Slowly, I started noticing small changes. My sleep improved, my back pain eased, and I felt calmer and more focused.
normalised: My initial attempts were clumsy and frustrating. I couldn't hold a downward-facing dog for more than ten seconds, and my attempts at Trikonasana were laughable. But something kept me going back. Slowly, I started noticing small changes. My sleep improved, my back pain eased, and I felt calmer and more focused.

unnormalised: Now, I practice regularly. I find time for a quick Surya Namaskar before work, even if it’s just for 15 minutes. And on weekends, I attend a longer session at a local ashram. It's not about achieving perfect poses; it's about connecting with my breath and finding a sense of peace within myself. I now wake up at 05:30 AM on Sundays just to practice. It reminds me of my trip to Rishikesh on 12/12/2023, the birthplace of Yoga, which further solidified my belief in its power. Trust me, give it a try. You might be surprised at what you discover.
